# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(str)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
print(wrap_string("Hello world. This is a very long sentence that will wrap into multiple lines based on the text width provided."))
```

This function takes a string `str` and an optional `text_width` parameter and returns a new string where each line is wrapped at the specified width or the nearest break point (a space) within the string. If no newline character is needed, it will simply return a single line of text that wraps at the given width without adding any newlines.
